newsitem.title: MEXICO: Banca Promex to buy Banco Union outlets.
newsitem.headline: Banca Promex to buy Banco Union outlets.

text.p: Banca Promex has signed a letter of intent to buy the retail outlets of Banco Union, the National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV) said.
Promex will pay market value for the outlets plus a 2.0 percent premium on some of its liabilities, the CNBV said in a statement on Monday.
Banco Union was intervened by the government during September 1994 after a fraud scandal forced its director, Carlos Cabal Peniche, to flee the country. He is still at large.
The CNBV said the government's bank support program Fobaproa will continue to manage Banco Union's head offices for the time being until Promex can take over management.
Banca Promex is a unit of financial group Promex-Finamex .
"Through this operation, Banco Union's outlets return to private hands, ratifying the government's desire to allow the private sector to manage the country's banks," the CNBV said.
